website_summaries.verdict: The AKG K495 NCs aren't as comfortable and don't sound quite as good as the Bose QC 15s, but they're built better, offer very good noise-cancellation, and recharge via USB.
pros: The AKG K495 NCs are stylish, well-built headphones with excellent fit and finish
They sound good, offer effective noise cancellation, and are rechargeable via USB
They also fold flat and come with a nice carrying case and can play without the noise cancellation engaged
cons: At $350, they're pricey--and should sound even more refined
a little light on the bass

customer_reviews.title: Plastic connector breaks regularly every 3 months or so
customer_reviews.text: I'm am already at my third pair of AKG K495 NC. Each one has been breaking regularly at the same place every 3 months or so. This issue appears to be common among many costumers of the same product (look up 'cnet reviews AKG K495NC' on google) It's an amazing product as far as the acoustics. The problem I'm experiencing is however a design flaw of the headphones which causes the plastic connector to break after 3-4 months of usage. I have been extremely gentle with these headphones and I realize that even a new pair would cause the same problem after 3-4 months due to fatigue stressing of the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Scalo

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, excellent noise-canceling, flawed product
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones — I strongly prefer on-ear vs over-ear, but that's certainly a personal preference. The noise canceling works great, even on long flights. But I simply can't recommend this product. The extenders that allow you to adjust the position of the headphones is made of flimsy plastic that has a design flaw. I've gone through 2 replacements, despite being incredibly gentle with them. I close the extenders when not in use, and especially in the case, but that only extends the life of the headphones by a month or two.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones until they break
customer_reviews.text: Headphones had amazing sound for the 14 months they worked, then the headband to speaker junction broke. All attempts to contact the company for a repair or replacement have failed. 100% unresponsive to date. I wil amend this review if they do respond to me appropriately Update (4/2/2015): Company responded, and after a few email conversations they agreed to replace the unit. I was given a return shipping authorization and am shipping the original unit back to the company for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Medical Rock Star

customer_reviews.title: Really like these.
customer_reviews.text: Better than the K-490NC which I have. Bigger though. Yes if you push the ear pads from the outside they do make a sort of electronic noise you can hear but apart from that well made and sound great. Need to wear them in a bit as like most of them, except the 490NC they can warm up the ears a bit. Sits on the ears not over the ears. Very good noise cancelling and cuts out close conversations out better than some.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to store in its case when not in use
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and good noise canceling. Not quite as comfortable over an 8 hour period as high-end Bose headphones and not quite as effective at canceling noise in aircraft. Gives the impression of high quality bomb proof construction, but I made the mistake of treating these roughly at some point and the weak plastic piece that connects the headphone driver to the head band broke. I was not able to really glue it back together adequately.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Turing

customer_reviews.title: Poor cabling
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace my old Sennheiser noise cancelling headphones after PC Mag made them highly recommended. But every time I moved the loose connection of the 3.5mm cable into the headphones caused horrible crackling which made the headphones unusable. Amazon said they were not replaceable when I sent them back so I got Sony MDR 200s and I'm very happy whit those on long transatlantic flights.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is good. They tend to favor the mids over the ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good. They tend to favor the mids over the rest of the range, which is good for conversation and better in my view) than a boomy, jacked up bass response. Headphones are not particularly lightweight or comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: bjgroup

customer_reviews.title: Great sound,  however, you will want to invest in an additional cord!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband owned an earlier version of these--which he loved, I broke them. We ordered these and the two cords they came with did not work well- they were staticy and gave a lot of feedback. We tried the cord that came with our older AKGs and the sound is perfect. I would recommend getting these, but not sure what to say as a solution to the cords....
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Cantilever is broken just two mouth of use, the ...
customer_reviews.text: Cantilever is broken just two mouth of use, the seller just provide three warranty, and the manufacture of Harman and Akg of America don't response my repair requirement at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chenqs

customer_reviews.title: this is an useless product. I would hope that on an airplane ...
customer_reviews.text: In an office environment these accentuate voices from the other coworkers to such a degree that for me, this is an useless product. I would hope that on an airplane they'll fare better.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Faulty design.
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke within 2 months, WHILE THEY WERE SITTING ON MY HEAD, and the warranty company refused to fulfill the warranty, saying it was due to an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Blagg

customer_reviews.title: and they have a great and very musical sound
customer_reviews.text: I use these on airplanes, and they have a great and very musical sound, and are also good at noise reduction too. They are a little tricky to get fitted correctly, and can slide off the head at times
customer_reviews.author: Gazza 61

customer_reviews.title: Would buy them again!
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile. I have a TBI (traumatic brain injury) and need to control noise levels. While these don't eliminate all noise, they are comfortable to wear all day. The switch is not a problem for me, I rather like it. It is great that they recharge via USB hub, as I use these 40 hours/week. Stylish, comfortable, well made, great noise cancellation, and when I use them to actually listen to music, they are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Claymiac

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones in every way. Very well constructed. Great sound quality. Very comfortable. Great noise cancelling; eliminates almost all background noise when flying or riding the subway. Would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Music listener

customer_reviews.title: They are the best sounding cans I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: They are the best sounding cans I have ever owned, but after only three months, they broke just above the left earpiece. I immediately ordered another pair and am currently trying to send back the other ones to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: john blair

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bose
customer_reviews.text: These phones are big, heavy and very well made. Not too heavy so as to dislodge a vertebrae, but noticeable mass. I got used to them within 5 minutes because the quality of the sound and noise cancellation both are very, very good. They also work well when the internal battery is dead and that is a great feature. I especially like the special modes that can be set - the 'wife cancellation' mode, dog wanting to go out mode and especially the '16 year old daughter asking for money' complete cancellation mode...
customer_reviews.author: Wwiii

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: NIce but I prefer my wife's bose. They are a tight fit and after 2-3 hrs they become uncomfortable. I didn't think they would be that tight. Sound was very good but overall I guess I should have bought Bose or something more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE S.

customer_reviews.title: cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: Plastic connector to ear piece fatigued and broke. Purchased 12/12 broken 8/13. Great sound but I expected to get more than nine months of service from a 300 dollar item. I then contacted Harmon Kardom and they exchanged it for the cost of shipping the old one back! Great folks Many thanks.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when you take these headphones off!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: They sound great No Batteries, has USB coord to charge. CONS: I am extremely upset on the quality. After a few months of owning them, I took them off one day and the ear piece just cracked off. now it just dangles. I super glued it, and the next day the otherside cracked! What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Theofanis Melios

customer_reviews.title: AKG headphones
customer_reviews.text: these are excellent headphones, sound better and are more comfortable than my qe15's.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Parks

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sound!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the Bose are lighter and slightly more comfortable, but if sound quality is important, the AKG's acoustics are MUCH, MUCH better!
customer_reviews.author: R. Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, Great Quality love the output and the NC is very effective. Comes with a very nice leather carrying case. The wires are also of the highest quality. Seller was very accommodating with my order error (I was ordering multiple items) and shipped extremely quick. There are quite a bit of video reviews online so I'll leave it at that.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Swearingen

customer_reviews.title: 2 headphones broke in exactly the same place. Design floor
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones -- great, deep, rich sound quality. However, I experienced the same issue as Theofanis Melios. The hinge broke within 2 months -- ( note: I used with delicacy & care). I was very surprised at the low durability given the very refined aesthetic and Germanesque product design. UPDATE 10.25.2013: My replacement also just broke in exactly the same way. I had been extremely carful with the hinge. This product has a physical design floor period.
customer_reviews.author: Dbu

customer_reviews.title: One of the best NC headphones on the market but has some QC issues
customer_reviews.text: After a long search for a audiophile grade NC headphones, I have found them. When it is function properly, it produce good quality sound. And I was surprised by the bass reproduction for a product like this (of course not at the same standard as those more expensive audiophile headphones which need a headphone amp to drive). But there is some rattling in the left ear cup. After some investigation, I found that the noise was cause by the cushion rubbing against the cup casing. AKG really need to fix this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Sound Terrible
customer_reviews.text: My main purpose of buying noise canceling headphones was to use on red-eye flights. After flying several red-eyes without them and never being able to sleep, I tried some on that were giving to me on a flight and I slept great. The other thing I am looking for is sound quality, When not traveling I listen to music with a pair of Grado SR80i headphones, best $100 I ever spent. After unpacking these, I plugged them into my headphone amp I have in my office. 3 seconds later they come off and I started packing them back up. The sound was awful. Additionally, the unit I received was open-box with clear signs of usage and an accessory was missing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sounds great
customer_reviews.text: sounds great. liked NC compared to bose one. fast shipping. worth of money. packaging was nice. hav multiple plugs for different countries n stuff. usb charge yeah
customer_reviews.author: Seong Jong Yu

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, Fair noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality. The noise cancellation is fair, but not as good at some of the other brands (Bose, Sony). Since is on ear they are not quite as comfortable at around ear ones.
customer_reviews.author: Stig Rune Søberg

customer_reviews.title: Not good as expected. left side doesnt work properly
customer_reviews.text: The left side doesnt work after 3 days. I just returned it.To be honest, its not good. If you want to purchase think about it
customer_reviews.author: Beihong Chen

customer_reviews.title: Construction issue
customer_reviews.text: The performance of this headphone is great. Unfortunately, the mechanical design is terrible. The joint between the adjustable band and the left earpiece is very weak. IT broke within 2 weeks of use. I have a larger than average head size and pulling the speakers apart to get over my ears resulted in failure because the point is weaker than the metal spring used to add flex to the headband. I have spent time in reinforcing the joint but have not yet been successful. I have not given up because the noise cancelling and audio are both wonderful - I want to find a solution!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Poor Build Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Would never buy AKG again!! Poor build quality!!! Mine broke after one month where the model name in written on the side. Amazon sent out a replacement and the new one broke in exactly the same place. I tried to glue it, and it worked so I didn't send it back but then it broke again, just above the previous break. This is clearly a faulty product which never should have gone to market!! The plastic way was too brittle for the job it needed to do. Extremely disappointed! The sound quality was great, but this model was badly made and tested before going to market. Any reputable brand would accept responsibility for their manufacturing flaw, but not AKG.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM COTTAM

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Absolutely Horrible, Shoddy, Cheap Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: First off, these headphones sound great. The noise-canceling is excellent, and the audio quality it superb. When I first got these headphones, I really loved using them every day at my desk. However, I am now on my second pair, and am awaiting someone from customer service to get back with me so I can get this pair replaced as well. Why, you ask? Because the plastic where the earpieces connect to the headband was so poorly designed that it breaks with all the strength of butter. Seriously, it's absolutely horrible. On top of that, the customer services is terrible. I sent an email to them two days ago and still have not heard a thing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scheel

customer_reviews.title: These break very easilly, but they do sound good.
customer_reviews.text: Warning: the bracket that holds the earpiece to the head band is flimsy. If you have an above average width head I would avoid these headphones. I am on my second pair (customer service is great BTW, they replaced the broken set the first time and hopefully they will help me out now that the second pair broke). I was EXTREMELY careful with the second set to avoid breakage. On the flip side, I tried every noise cancelling pair of headphone on the market and these sound the best. The Noise Cancellation is second only to Bose Quiet Comfort, but I don’t mind the compromise for superior sounding audio. I just wish they would be more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: KNB

customer_reviews.title: Break they will
customer_reviews.text: These are the best noise-cancelling headphones on the market. But you have to sit still when you are using them, no moving is allowed since they will either fall off or cause a noise on your ear. worse though, the construction is too weak they will break without any violence. It seems that AKG don't care. The problem is well-known and obvious. AKG should of course had fixed the design long ago. It is not rocket science to fix the design. Update 2015, 22 June. Accordint to AKG/HK they have improved the plastic material to make it stronger. I got a new pair fromAKG on my guarantee..
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lake

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Headband extension quality is terrible, 2 times failed similarly from the brittle plastic part in extension during first headphones was replaced under warranty but warranty was not valid anymore while the second headphones failed. Was using it only when travelling around 20 times per year. Contacted the Harman support but they said there is no replacament parts for this model so I'm forced to throw it away. Lifespan of the AKG K 495 NC is terrible, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AKG has better noise cancelling but could only wear for 1 1/2 ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 months after purchase one ear peice snapped off. 3 weeks under warranty. . Same again but 2 months later. went out and bought Bose, AKG has better noise cancelling but could only wear for 1 1/2 before hurt ears. Bose very comfy but needs to insert battery for noise canceling which is easy to forget and leave on. AKG has USB charging. for me Bose were better
customer_reviews.author: graham

customer_reviews.title: Good initial audio quality, but major design flaws and longevity concerns – stay away
customer_reviews.text: Pros: good sound quality, strong battery life, playback without battery life (non noise cancelling) Cons: two sets have had terrible left ear rattle shortly after purchase/replacement, uncomfortable for long listening sessions (2hr+), poor customer service Ultimately I was able to get about 30 hours of good listening experience out of these cans, or ~$10/hour of good quality playback. While the initial sound quality is better than Beats and other similar headsets, the longevity and design flaws and poor customer service make it difficult to recommend purchasing these to anyone for any price >$50.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Foster

customer_reviews.title: Sounds nice and good ANC but they will break :(
customer_reviews.text: Cross posting my review from the 490-review: I have really mixed feelings of these cans and the K490NC model as well. They both are small, portable and comfortable and sound nice with and without the noice cancelling. Of course the 495 suppress noices better as they are a bit bigger but 495 doesn't sound as nice as 490. Really nice to carry around and enjoy music. The problem is that the build quality is really bad. Sooner or later they will break just because the plastic is too soft or the design is bad or both. Had lost pairs of each, so beware.
customer_reviews.author: trm42

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great looking... terrible design/construction
customer_reviews.text: I've broken two different pairs and while HK has sent me replacements, that's a lot of missed time. I ended up having to shell out for ANOTHER very expensive pair of headphones while I waited on the replacements. Now I only used these in my office and I take the Bose on the road. Given the high price I paid for these, the construction issues are really unconscionable.
customer_reviews.author: DMV

customer_reviews.title: K-495NC USB cable replacement
customer_reviews.text: The K-495NC is extremely well built but they require two proprietary cables - one audio (3.5mm to 2.5mm) and one charging (USB to 2.5mm). I've found no online source but replacements can easily be purchased directly from Harman's factory direct sales. Here's the details I found: parts department: (877) 871-6755 1.5m audio cable: p/n 2551K00030 2.0m audio cable: p/n 2551K00130 USB charging cable: p/n 2551K00090 ($10.50 +3.98 shipping)
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality build and the ends where the plastic connect ...
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality build and the ends where the plastic connect the top portion to the ear swivel break. The manufacturer doesn't support them so stay clear of this company. The sound quality is good but cheap manufacturing is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Moreira

customer_reviews.title: nice headphones. i like the way it looked and ...
customer_reviews.text: nice headphones. i like the way it looked and the sound. though the bass is not that powerful. yesterday my left arm snapped and there no way to fix it. i found that many people experience the same. Those arm are really weak. AKG has no service for that in US. Will throw em away.
customer_reviews.author: maxim kitaev

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Sound
customer_reviews.text: When you look at noise cancelling headphones one will always come across the Bose range. I have used the Bose QC15 on many many hours on planes and they are good headphones. However these AKG phones sound so much better its hard to believe they are not more popular in the market. The fit and finish is outstanding. Wearing them for hours while working in the office is very comfortable. The sound. Wow. They are so clean, crisp and defined with just the right amount of bass. Quite amazing headphones with very good noise cancelling qualities. If you are serious about sound quality, these are the ones to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: THEY WILL BREAK WITHIN 2-3 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE THESE HEADPHONES! - Although the sound is great they will not last more than 1 or 2 months before the plastic that attaches the earpieces cracks and breaks. Read the reviews, Almost everyone has this same issue. I'm on my 3rd replacement from the manufacturer and all have had the same issue. Now the warranty period has expired (1 year) and they will no longer replace them. STAY AWAY FROM THESE HEADPHONES!! It doesn't matter how careful you are with them, they will fail.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Stay away if you have a wide head
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sounds good, if not great, but they are very tight on a wide head so will eventually give you a headache. What's worse is after a few months use they will completely break. I had two pairs and they both suffered the same fate. I would advise you to stay away.
customer_reviews.author: lecrappe

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sound
customer_reviews.text: Good quality sound, but given how much I paid (more than $250), unhappy with the fact they broke within 3 years of purchase. I did not travel with the headphones, I would use them in the office and they would stay in the office.
customer_reviews.author: Max Roy

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. Swivel/collapsible ear pieces will break. Great sound, poor design. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product I ever used
customer_reviews.text: First left side plastic part was broken suddenly and later the other side was broken again. I did not give it a stress it is just broken during normal use. Horrible product I ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Dongsun Kim

customer_reviews.title: not good not bad
customer_reviews.text: there is some noise at the nc switch,switch is not very compact!! I don't know if everyone is like this noise......
customer_reviews.author: yuchen

product_meta.title: AKG K-495NC Noise-Cancelling Headphones
product_meta.description: Size:No Bluetooth capability| Color:Black"Stylish, Well-Built With Excellent Fit And Finish" As you probably already guessed, 'NC' stands for 'noise cancelling.' But it could also stand for 'no contest,' because when it comes to pure, undisturbed sound, the AKG K495 NC headphones deliver high-quality performance and active noise control that are second to none. "The AKG K495 NCs are stylish, well-built headphones with excellent fit and finish," reports CNET.com in a February 13, 2012 review. "They sound good, offer effective noise cancellation, and are rechargeable via USB. They also fold flat and come with a nice carrying case and can play without the noise cancellation engaged." Durable and easy to charge through a USB connection, these top-of-the-line headphones create a nearly perfect audio world; you get all of the sound that you want, but without the sound that you don't want. Although a charged battery is needed if you're using the noise canceling circuitry, don't worry if walk out of the house with your AKGs and you forgot to recharge. You can still use the K495 NC in 'passive mode' without the noise canceling circuitry, and they'll still sound superb.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars72 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
